decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Within six months of the date of this permission the development shall be begun and the external elevations of the building hereby approved shall be completed in accordance with the approved plans, and shall be so maintained at all times thereafter

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (ML.1S.LP.01 - Location plan, ML.1S.EX.01 - Existing site plan, ML.1S.EX.02 - Existing site elevations, ML.1S.PR.04 - Proposed site elevations, Post mitigation Environmental Noise Assessment Report ref CH/ONA/2015/30 dated August 2015, Supplementary Noise Note ref. CH/TN/2017/38 dated 23/10/2017, Supporting statement dated 06/10/2017 received on 03/11/2017.ML.1S.PR.03 A - Proposed site plan, Supporting statement V2 dated 25/01/2018 received on 01/02/2018. Manufacturer's specification for High speed doors produced by Dortek hygienic door systems received on 03/07/2018. 2 x unnumbered 3D images showing building with roller doors open and closed received on 18/07/2018.) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the submitted plans and prior to the first lawful use of the site for car sales, a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected, including a low wall (600mm high) to be constructed behind the back edge of footway at the front of the site, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
The boundary treatment shall be completed before the lawful use of the site for car sales commences. 
Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the first lawful use of the building as a jet wash bay post completion noise tests shall be carried out outside the building by accredited/approved organisations in accordance with the requirements of BS4142: 2014 to demonstrate the noise emissions from the site. An acoustic validation assessment detailing the results of the test reports shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall operate in accordance with the maximum noise emissions identified in the approved acoustic validation assessment.
Condition : 5 - The vertical doors in the openings of the building hereby approved shall be closed at all times when vehicles are being washed within the building

Condition : 6 - The use of the site, as a car wash and for car sales, hereby permitted shall not be carried on outside the following times 08.00 to 19.00 Monday to Saturdays and 09.00 to 18.00 on Sundays, including Bank Holidays

Condition : 7 - Prior to the first lawful occupation of the building or the use of the site for car sales hereby approved a Site Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include details of the appointment system for the car sales element of the business and monitoring of customer numbers and trips to the site.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter.
Condition : 8 - All cars for sale associated with the business shall be parked within the site boundaries and within the marked bays. No cars for sale shall be parked on the public highway.
Condition : 9 - No deliveries or collections of vehicles shall be carried out by a lorry or transporter. No vans over 3.5 tonnes or lorries shall be washed or cleaned at the s

Condition : 10 - Prior to the first lawful occupation of the building hereby approved full details of all proposed ventilation and any other mechanical services plant shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the location of all plant, manufacturers' specifications and predicted noise emissions.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 11 - Notwithstanding the approved plans and prior to e first lawful occupation of the building or the use of the site for car sales hereby approved, full details (including manufacturers' specifications) of cycle parking facilities for employees and visitors of the use shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The approved facilities shall conform to current guidance such as the TfL London Cycling Design Standards in design and layout and shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
description: Erection of a single storey rear extension to an existing rear shed used as jet wash bay area, provision of car park area inside the yard and expand use of site to include car sales.
